abstract.para: This document is intended for software developers who are interested in developing applications using the Rackspace Cloud Files API.

revdescription.para: Removed the section "Bulk importing of data" from the Cloud Files Developer Guide. Starting January 1, 2015, this service will not be available.

In the description for the operation to CDN-enable and CDN-disable a container at "CDN-enable and CDN-disable a container", corrected the X-Cdn-Uri response parameter type to string and noted that this response parameter is required.

Updated the table in "Absolute limits" in the Cloud Files Developer Guide for the rate limit for write operations to read "100 write operations per second per container" rather than "100 operations per second".
Updated “Set account TempURL metadata key” by adding information about changing X-Account-Meta-Temp-Url-Key and the use of a second key, X-Account-Meta-Temp-Url-Key-2.

listitem.para:
Updated "CORS" in the Cloud Files Developer Guide. This section now includes the following subsections to describe the available access control headers:
"CORS headers for containers"
"CORS headers for objects""
Added a note to "Create a static website" in the Cloud Files Developer Guide about how to disable a static website that you have created.
Added an example request to "Extracting archive files" in the Cloud Files Developer Guide.

Updated "FormPost" in the Cloud Files Developer Guide by adding the following information:
Additional information about the max_file_count parameter
A description for the x-delete-at and x-delete-after parameters
These parameters allow you to set the expiration for an object that gets uploaded using FormPost.
Corrected the link to service access endpoint information in "List CDN-enabled containers" in the Cloud Files Developer Guide.

revdescription.para: In the "Service access endpoints" sections in the Cloud Files Getting Started Guide and in the Cloud Files Developer Guide, added a link to http://ord.admin.kc.rakr.net/knowledge_center/article/about-regions to provide guidance on choosing a regionalized endpoint.

listitem.para: Changed the format for CDN logs from storing the month as 3 letters to using the following format: DD/MM/YYYY (for example, 16/07/2014).
Added the section "CDN log delivery" to the Cloud Files Developer Guide.
Published Cloud Files Getting Started Guide. This guide replaces the Cloud Files Introduction.
Changed the TTL maximum value to 1 year (31536000 seconds) instead of 50 years (1577836800 seconds) throughout the Cloud Files Developer Guide.
Removed Chapter 14, "Examples using cURL" from the Cloud Files Developer Guide. This information is now included with other cURL examples in the new Cloud Files Getting Started Guide.
Added the section "Container Access Control Lists" to the Cloud Files Developer Guide.
Added the Sydney data center as a location that provides bulk imports.
Added header descriptions to the "API operations for storage services" chapter in the Cloud Files Developer Guide.
Updated the table in the "Absolute limits" section of the Cloud Files Developer Guide to include the rate limit for write operations, which is 100 operations per second per container.
Updated the following object methods to include the X-Detect-Content-Type header in the request:
PUT (Create or update object)
POST (Update object metadata)
COPY (Copy object)
If you set this header to True, the Content-Type that is sent in the request (if any) is ignored, and Content-Type is guessed by using the Python mimetypes library based on the object path.

Reworked the "API operations for storage services" chapter and the "API operations for CDN services" chapter by using Web Application Description Language (WADL) files for the resource and method descriptions.
Updated the instructions for locating the API Key in the Cloud Control Panel in "Retrieving the authentication token" section.
Added a table of all API operations, which lists and briefly describes all API operations. Also added tables showing the API operations at the beginning of each section that describes the operations.
Added service access endpoints for the CDN management service component ( cloudfilesCDN) to the "Service access endpoints" section.
Updated account information in the "Service access endpoints" section to show MossoCloudFS_aaaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd-eeeeeeeeeeee rather than 1234.
Added the "Cloud Files service contract version" section.
Added the "Absolute limits" section.
Added the "Request and response types" section.
Added the "Update account metadata" section.
Added the "Delete account metadata" section.
In all examples, updated the X-Auth-Token to use the current format returned by an authentication request (no dashes). Also updated examples to use real values for account, container, and object.
Added the "Create large objects" section with more information about dynamic large objects and static large objects.
Updated the "Extract archive" section to include a note about using a blank Content-Type to have Cloud Files determine the file type for the archive.

Replaced references to X-Storage-Url and X-Cdn-Management–Url throughout this document with references to the cloudFiles and cloudFilesCDN endpoints in the service catalog based on use of Identity v2.0 rather than Identity v1.0.
Updated the "Authentication" section to include new references to additional information about the service access endpoints and the service catalog.
Updated the "Authentication" to show a cURL example for Identity v2.0 only.
Added the "Service access endpoint" section, which includes all endpoints for Cloud Files including the newest one in Hong Kong.
Updated the "Authentication" section to show information for Rackspace Identity v2.0.
Updated the "Create the form" section to indicate that the value of redirect can be empty to indicate that no redirect is included on the form.
Added the "RBAC" section for the addition of Role Based Access Control to Cloud Files.
Updated the "CORS" section.
Updated responses to show application/json in the "Bulk delete" section.
Added X-Container-Meta-Web-Listings, X-Container-Meta-Web-Listings-Css, and X-Container-Meta-Web-Directory-Type to the "Create a static website"section.
Clarified information about redirect and expires in the "Create the form" section.
In the "Authentication" section, changed references for authentication to point to v2.0.
In the "Authentication" section, updated the example to show v2.0 for authentication.
In the "CDN object services" section and the "Delete CDN objects" section, added a note about removing a CDN-enabled container by setting X-Cdn-Enabled to False in HEAD.

Added a link in the "Overview" section to the Knowledge Center article, "Best Practices for Using Cloud Files," at http://www.rackspace.com/knowledge_center/article/best-practices-for-using-cloud-files.
Added the "Container quotas" section.
Created a new section "Object services". This section includes new and previously existing information specifically related to storage objects.
Added the "Static large object creation" section.
Added the "Bulk operations" section.
Added the "Override TempURL file names" section.
Changed location of SDKs. Added note on object metadata behavior.
Added iOS Streaming.
Fixed internal linking.
Added end_marker list parameter and CORS container headers.
Updated language binding language and links.
Updated view CDN-enabled header.
Added Access Log Delivery. Updated auth point.
Added multi-region, legal, and CDN charge note.
Changed TTL limits and CDN URLs.
Added CDN object purge limits.
Added Bulk import information.
Added object versioning and static web information.
Added TempURL and FormPost.
Fixed doc tickets.
Revisions to clarify issues brought up in doc tickets. Formatted HEAD like other commands. Standardized on URL. Added expiring objects and service net information.
Revisions for the addition of expiring object functionality plus doc bug fixes including adding more cross-references for finding language bindings.
Revised information about how to perform a CDN purge, indicating you must contact support to request a container purge operation.
Added more detail about reasons to perform a CDN purge, clarifying that it is not required for deleting objects.
Added information about streaming containers to support this new streaming feature, including changing examples to match the streaming headers and URLs returned.
In the 6.1.1 Authorization example, changed X-Auth-Token to X-Auth-Key.
Added best practices for authentication tokens.
Added information about new headers including CORS headers.
HEAD returns 200 instead of 204 on an object metadata request.
TTL maximum value is now 50 years instead of 3 days, the minimum TTL is now 15 minutes (900 seconds), and the default is now 72 hours instead of 24 hours.
Added information about large object support.
Added information about container metadata.
Added a section about retrieving an SSL URL for CDN-enabled containers that are using HTTPS protocol.
Updated examples to contain SSL as appropriate.
Added information about the edge purge capability for CDN-enabled containers and objects.
Fixed error in the header range example that stated first instead of last when fetching a portion of the data.
Updated CDN URLs to match new format.
Fixed error referring to X-Auth-User instead of X-Auth-Key.
Removed references to ACL (Access Control List).
Fixed error in examples referring to X-Auth-Key where it should be X-Auth-Token.
Added section numbers.
Expanded authentication information for UK release.
Added delimiter as a query parameter and server-side object copy example.
Initial release.

preface.title: Preface
preface.para: This document describes new features and changes for the Cloud Files API.
For detailed information about the Cloud Files API, see the following documentation at http://docs.rackspace.com/:
Support for Cloud Files is available 24x7x365 via phone or chat, or you can also file a ticket.
You can also provide feedback by using the Product Feedback forum.
Join the Cloud Files chat room at Freenode IRC at #cloudfiles.
Rackspace welcomes your comments, feedback, and bug reports.

chapter.title: Jun 01, 2012
chapter.para: This release contains new features and documentation changes for Cloud Files.

listitem.para: Static web and custom error page for static web

Use Cloud Files to create a web site that uses your containers and objects to deliver content on the World Wide Web. Create a custom error page for your users so that they don't get generic, unbranded error pages like 404 pages.
Object versioning

Keep track of previous versions of objects from a container. Assign a container to hold the non-current versions so that when you make content changes to an object, previous versions are stored automatically and marked with a timestamp.
